intro: Hutchinsia torreana, commonly known as the Torreana daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, herbaceous stems. Hutchinsia torreana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
